course_title: Special Topics in Biology: The Science of Teaching
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: How do we help people learn?  Turns out that students often have misconceptions, outdated ideas, and bad habits (#cram, #all-nighter) that cause them to waste time, limit learning, and hurt performance (i.e., grades).  Teaching in the sciences is especially challenging; yet, we can use pedagogy science (a.k.a. education research) to guide our plans.  After college, you will probably use some techniques of training/teaching in whatever career you choose.  This will prepare you for that, but also make you a better scientist.
course_description: A course on topics of special biological interest, designed for Biology majors elective credit. This course is repeatable when the topic varies.
prerequisites: (BIOL 142 and BIOL 142L) or BIOL_OX 142 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 2430, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 4-5:15p, Instructor: R. Spell, Status: Open
